name: Herb-Seared Pork Fillet with Garlic-Lemon Brussels Sprouts
description: Quick-seared pork fillet finished in the oven with oregano, lemon, and butter. Served with skillet-brightened Brussels sprouts for a mild, keto-friendly family plate.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 200°C/400°F with a rack in the middle.
Trim any silver skin from the pork fillet and pat dry.
Halve the brussels sprouts; quarter any very large ones.
cook_steps: Season pork fillet all over with salt, black pepper, and oregano; rub with olive oil.
Heat an oven-safe skillet over medium-high on the stovetop; sear pork on all sides until browned, 4–5 minutes total.
Add 1 tablespoon butter, half the minced garlic, and half the lemon zest to the skillet; spoon over pork for 30 seconds.
Transfer skillet to the oven and roast until the thickest part reaches 63°C/145°F, about 10–12 minutes; rest pork on a board, tented with foil.
While pork roasts, heat a large frying pan over medium; add olive oil and the brussels sprouts cut-side down. Cook without stirring until browned, 3–4 minutes.
Add remaining minced garlic and lemon zest; toss 30 seconds. Season with salt and black pepper.
Add remaining butter and a squeeze of lemon juice; toss to glaze, then sprinkle with parsley.
Slice pork into medallions and serve with the garlicky brussels sprouts. Offer extra lemon wedges to taste.
